text: Huáng Yǒng Pīng (; 18 February 1954 – 20 October 2019) was a Chinese-French contemporary artist and one of the most famous Chinese Avant-garde artists. He was born in Xiamen, China. He was seen as the most controversial artist of the Chinese art scene in the 1980s. In 1999, Huang represented France in the Venice Biennale. In 2016, his piece "Empires" was selected for the Monumenta biennial exposition at the Grand Palais in Paris. Huang died in Paris, aged 65, on 20 October 2019. The cause of death was a cerebral hemorrhage. ==References== Category:1954 births Category:2019 deaths Category:French artists Category:Chinese artists Category:People who lost Chinese citizenship
